result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles N Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management & Domestic Abuse.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles N Grant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles N Grant in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend to misd. bail jumping.   No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
2 years Probation
Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Mgmt. & Domestic Abuse.
$243.00 C/C + $200.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Return date on June 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Charles N Grant in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Michael X Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests reset. Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Charles N Grant in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steinman requests reset to talk to DA.  Bonds continued.  Return date scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Return date on April 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Charles N Grant in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Steinman states DE will waive time limits for PH at this time and requests PTC and RD.  Bond continued.  13CF445 to track.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Charles N Grant by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Charles N Grant in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance in 14CF85 and warrant in 13CF445.  DE does qualify for PD appt in both cases.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond of $500 on each case.  Atty Steinman responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $500.00 cash bond set in 13CF445 and $250.00 cash bond in 14CF85.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/S.B. in 14CF85.  Bond conditions continue as previously ordered in 13CF445.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
